snippet: Unlike other major sports teams, Barça has its members — about 160,000 of them — vote for its president, with paper ballots. They will have to consider charges of corruption and other hard issues.
abstract: Roughly 160,000 members of soccer club FC Barcelona are preparing for annual vote to elect team's president; process is deeply meaningful to members, but has also suffered criticism for its impracticality; voters in this year's election will have to navigate charges of corruption, club intrigue and blatant pandering by candidates.
lead_paragraph: Unlike other major sports teams, Barça has its members — about 160,000 of them — vote for its president, with paper ballots. They will have to consider charges of corruption and other hard issues.

headline.main: On One Point Voters Agree: Barcelona Election Has Intrigue
headline.print_headline: On One Point Voters Agree: Club Election Has Intrigue
